name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 2:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.

**Note 3:**  In-transit metastasis is coded in regional lymph nodes.

**Note 4:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Lesion(s) confirmed to dermis
    Localized, NOS
    Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)

**Note 5:**  Lesion(s) confined to the dermis or extension into the subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis) are assigned the T category based on tumor size.
rows:
Tumor invades deep extradermal structures, 
i.e., cartilage, skeletal muscle, fascia, or bone

Fascia

Underlying cartilage, bone, skeletal muscle

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4 with no other information on extension

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Stated as T1 with no other information on extension

Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest
dimension
Stated as T2 with no other information on extension
Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
Stated as T3 with no other information on extension
